name: Intensive Indigenous Language of Latin America I
description: Introduction to an indigenous language of Latin America. Designed to provide students with the basics of grammar and vocabulary; the to ability to engage in simple, colloquial conversation; and basic writing skills as foundation for further study. The equivalent of six lecture hours a week for one semester.  May be repeated for credit when the topics vary.

name: Intensive Indigenous Language of Latin American II
description: Continuation in the study of an indigenous language of Latin America. Designed to introduce students to advanced subjects in grammar and vocabulary and develop advanced conversation, reading, and writing skills as a foundation for further study. The equivalent of six lecture hours a week for one semester.  May be repeated for credit when the topics vary. Prerequisite: Indigenous Languages of Latin America 601C with a grade of at least C.

name: Third-Year Indigenous Language of Latin America I
description: Advanced study of an indigenous language of Latin America, with an emphasis on advanced conversation and reading skills. Particular attention is given to cultural issues and discussion in the target language. Three lecture hours a week for one semester.  May be repeated for credit when the topics vary. Prerequisite: Indigenous Languages of Latin America 611C with a grade of at least C.

name: Third-Year Indigenous Language II
description: Three lecture hours a week for one semester.  May be repeated for credit when the topics vary. Prerequisite: Indigenous Languages of Latin America 321.
